place.name: STUBTON
place.gazetteerText: STUBTON, a parish in the district of Newark and county of Lincoln; 1 mile ESE of Claypole r. station, and 6 SE of Newark-Post town, Newark. Acres, 860. Real property, £2,113. Pop., 157. Houses, 34. The manor, with S. Hall, belongs to G. Nevile, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln.Value, £295.* Patron, G. Nevile, Esq. The church was rebuilt in 1800. Charities, £58. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
